pokemon.name: bulbasaur
pokemon.info: There is a plant seed on its back right from the day this Pokémon is born. The seed slowly grows larger.

pokemon.name: ivysaur
pokemon.info: When the bulb on its back grows large, it appears to lose the ability to stand on its hind legs.

pokemon.name: venusaur
pokemon.info: Its plant blooms when it is absorbing solar energy. It stays on the move to seek sunlight.

pokemon.name: charmander
pokemon.info: It has a preference for hot things. When it rains, steam is said to spout from the tip of its tail.

pokemon.name: charmeleon
pokemon.info: It has a barbaric nature. In battle, it whips its fiery tail around and slashes away with sharp claws.

pokemon.name: charizard
pokemon.info: It spits fire that is hot enough to melt boulders. It may cause forest fires by blowing flames.

pokemon.name: squirtle
pokemon.info: When it retracts its long neck into its shell, it squirts out water with vigorous force.

pokemon.name: wartortle
pokemon.info: It is recognized as a symbol of longevity. If its shell has algae on it, that Wartortle is very old.

pokemon.name: blastoise
pokemon.info: It crushes its foe under its heavy body to cause fainting. In a pinch, it will withdraw inside its shell.

pokemon.name: caterpie
pokemon.info: For protection, it releases a horrible stench from the antenna on its head to drive away enemies.

pokemon.name: metapod
pokemon.info: It is waiting for the moment to evolve. At this stage, it can only harden, so it remains motionless to avoid attack.

pokemon.name: butterfree
pokemon.info: In battle, it flaps its wings at great speed to release highly toxic dust into the air.

pokemon.name: weedle
pokemon.info: Beware of the sharp stinger on its head. It hides in grass and bushes where it eats leaves.

pokemon.name: kakuna
pokemon.info: Able to move only slightly. When endangered, it may stick out its stinger and poison its enemy.

pokemon.name: beedrill
pokemon.info: It has three poisonous stingers on its forelegs and its tail. They are used to jab its enemy repeatedly.

pokemon.name: pidgey
pokemon.info: Very docile. If attacked, it will often kick up sand to protect itself rather than fight back.

pokemon.name: pidgeotto
pokemon.info: This Pokémon is full of vitality. It constantly flies around its large territory in search of prey.

pokemon.name: pidgeot
pokemon.info: This Pokémon flies at Mach 2 speed, seeking prey. Its large talons are feared as wicked weapons.

pokemon.name: rattata
pokemon.info: Will chew on anything with its fangs. If you see one, you can be certain that 40 more live in the area.

pokemon.name: raticate
pokemon.info: Its hind feet are webbed. They act as flippers, so it can swim in rivers and hunt for prey.

pokemon.name: spearow
pokemon.info: Inept at flying high. However, it can fly around very fast to protect its territory.

pokemon.name: fearow
pokemon.info: A Pokémon that dates back many years. If it senses danger, it flies high and away, instantly.

pokemon.name: ekans
pokemon.info: The older it gets, the longer it grows. At night, it wraps its long body around tree branches to rest.

pokemon.name: arbok
pokemon.info: The frightening patterns on its belly have been studied. Six variations have been confirmed.

pokemon.name: pikachu
pokemon.info: Pikachu that can generate powerful electricity have cheek sacs that are extra soft and super stretchy.

pokemon.name: raichu
pokemon.info: Its long tail serves as a ground to protect itself from its own high-voltage power.

pokemon.name: sandshrew
pokemon.info: It loves to bathe in the grit of dry, sandy areas. By sand bathing, the Pokémon rids itself of dirt and moisture clinging to its body.

pokemon.name: sandslash
pokemon.info: The drier the area Sandslash lives in, the harder and smoother the Pokémon’s spikes will feel when touched.

pokemon.name: nidoran-f
pokemon.info: A mild-mannered Pokémon that does not like to fight. Beware—its small horn secretes venom.

pokemon.name: nidorina
pokemon.info: When resting deep in its burrow, its barbs always retract. This is proof that it is relaxed.

pokemon.name: nidoqueen
pokemon.info: Tough scales cover the sturdy body of this Pokémon. It appears that the scales grow in cycles.

pokemon.name: nidoran-m
pokemon.info: Its large ears are always kept upright. If it senses danger, it will attack with a poisonous sting.

pokemon.name: nidorino
pokemon.info: Its horn contains venom. If it stabs an enemy with the horn, the impact makes the poison leak out.

pokemon.name: nidoking
pokemon.info: Its steel-like hide adds to its powerful tackle. Its horns are so hard, they can pierce a diamond.

pokemon.name: clefairy
pokemon.info: It is said that happiness will come to those who see a gathering of Clefairy dancing under a full moon.

pokemon.name: clefable
pokemon.info: A timid fairy Pokémon that is rarely seen, it will run and hide the moment it senses people.

pokemon.name: vulpix
pokemon.info: While young, it has six gorgeous tails. When it grows, several new tails are sprouted.

pokemon.name: ninetales
pokemon.info: It is said to live 1,000 years, and each of its tails is loaded with supernatural powers.

pokemon.name: jigglypuff
pokemon.info: Jigglypuff has top-notch lung capacity, even by comparison to other Pokémon. It won’t stop singing its lullabies until its foes fall asleep.

pokemon.name: wigglytuff
pokemon.info: The more air it takes in, the more it inflates. If opponents catch it in a bad mood, it will inflate itself to an enormous size to intimidate them.

pokemon.name: zubat
pokemon.info: Emits ultrasonic cries while it flies. They act as a sonar used to check for objects in its way.

pokemon.name: golbat
pokemon.info: It attacks in a stealthy manner, without warning. Its sharp fangs are used to bite and to suck blood.

pokemon.name: oddish
pokemon.info: If exposed to moonlight, it starts to move. It roams far and wide at night to scatter its seeds.

pokemon.name: gloom
pokemon.info: Its pistils exude an incredibly foul odor. The horrid stench can cause fainting at a distance of 1.25 miles.

pokemon.name: vileplume
pokemon.info: It has the world’s largest petals. With every step, the petals shake out heavy clouds of toxic pollen.

pokemon.name: paras
pokemon.info: Burrows under the ground to gnaw on tree roots. The mushrooms on its back absorb most of the nutrition.

pokemon.name: parasect
pokemon.info: The bug host is drained of energy by the mushroom on its back. The mushroom appears to do all the thinking.

pokemon.name: venonat
pokemon.info: Its large eyes act as radar. In a bright place, you can see that they are clusters of many tiny eyes.

pokemon.name: venomoth
pokemon.info: The powdery scales on its wings are hard to remove from skin. They also contain poison that leaks out on contact.

pokemon.name: diglett
pokemon.info: If a Diglett digs through a field, it leaves the soil perfectly tilled and ideal for planting crops.

pokemon.name: dugtrio
pokemon.info: A team of Diglett triplets. It triggers huge earthquakes by burrowing 60 miles underground.

pokemon.name: meowth
pokemon.info: It loves to collect shiny things. If it’s in a good mood, it might even let its Trainer have a look at its hoard of treasures.

pokemon.name: persian
pokemon.info: Getting this prideful Pokémon to warm up to you takes a lot of effort, and it will claw at you the moment it gets annoyed.

pokemon.name: psyduck
pokemon.info: Psyduck is constantly beset by headaches. If the Pokémon lets its strange power erupt, apparently the pain subsides for a while.

pokemon.name: golduck
pokemon.info: This Pokémon lives in gently flowing rivers. It paddles through the water with its long limbs, putting its graceful swimming skills on display.

pokemon.name: mankey
pokemon.info: An agile Pokémon that lives in trees. It angers easily and will not hesitate to attack anything.

pokemon.name: primeape
pokemon.info: It stops being angry only when nobody else is around. To view this moment is very difficult.

pokemon.name: growlithe
pokemon.info: It has a brave and trustworthy nature. It fearlessly stands up to bigger and stronger foes.

pokemon.name: arcanine
pokemon.info: The sight of it running over 6,200 miles in a single day and night has captivated many people.

pokemon.name: poliwag
pokemon.info: For Poliwag, swimming is easier than walking. The swirl pattern on its belly is actually part of the Pokémon’s innards showing through the skin.

pokemon.name: poliwhirl
pokemon.info: Staring at the swirl on its belly causes drowsiness. This trait of Poliwhirl’s has been used in place of lullabies to get children to go to sleep.

pokemon.name: poliwrath
pokemon.info: Its body is solid muscle. When swimming through cold seas, Poliwrath uses its impressive arms to smash through drift ice and plow forward.

pokemon.name: abra
pokemon.info: This Pokémon uses its psychic powers while it sleeps. The contents of Abra’s dreams affect the powers that the Pokémon wields.

pokemon.name: kadabra
pokemon.info: Using its psychic power, Kadabra levitates as it sleeps. It uses its springy tail as a pillow.

pokemon.name: alakazam
pokemon.info: It has an incredibly high level of intelligence. Some say that Alakazam remembers everything that ever happens to it, from birth till death.

pokemon.name: machop
pokemon.info: Its whole body is composed of muscles. Even though it’s the size of a human child, it can hurl 100 grown-ups.

pokemon.name: machoke
pokemon.info: Its muscular body is so powerful, it must wear a power-save belt to be able to regulate its motions.

pokemon.name: machamp
pokemon.info: It quickly swings its four arms to rock its opponents with ceaseless punches and chops from all angles.

pokemon.name: bellsprout
pokemon.info: Prefers hot and humid places. It ensnares tiny bugs with its vines and devours them.

pokemon.name: weepinbell
pokemon.info: When hungry, it swallows anything that moves. Its hapless prey is dissolved by strong acids.

pokemon.name: victreebel
pokemon.info: Lures prey with the sweet aroma of honey. Swallowed whole, the prey is dissolved in a day, bones and all.

pokemon.name: tentacool
pokemon.info: Tentacool is not a particularly strong swimmer. It drifts across the surface of shallow seas as it searches for prey.

pokemon.name: tentacruel
pokemon.info: When the red orbs on Tentacruel’s head glow brightly, watch out. The Pokémon is about to fire off a burst of ultrasonic waves.

pokemon.name: geodude
pokemon.info: Commonly found near mountain trails and the like. If you step on one by accident, it gets angry.

pokemon.name: graveler
pokemon.info: Often seen rolling down mountain trails. Obstacles are just things to roll straight over, not avoid.

pokemon.name: golem
pokemon.info: Once it sheds its skin, its body turns tender and whitish. Its hide hardens when it’s exposed to air.

pokemon.name: ponyta
pokemon.info: It can’t run properly when it’s newly born. As it races around with others of its kind, its legs grow stronger.

pokemon.name: rapidash
pokemon.info: This Pokémon can be seen galloping through fields at speeds of up to 150 mph, its fiery mane fluttering in the wind.

pokemon.name: slowpoke
pokemon.info: Slow-witted and oblivious, this Pokémon won’t feel any pain if its tail gets eaten. It won’t notice when its tail grows back, either.

pokemon.name: slowbro
pokemon.info: Slowpoke became Slowbro when a Shellder bit on to its tail. Sweet flavors seeping from the tail make the Shellder feel as if its life is a dream.

pokemon.name: magnemite
pokemon.info: At times, Magnemite runs out of electricity and ends up on the ground. If you give batteries to a grounded Magnemite, it’ll start moving again.

pokemon.name: magneton
pokemon.info: This Pokémon is three Magnemite that have linked together. Magneton sends out powerful radio waves to study its surroundings.

pokemon.name: farfetchd
pokemon.info: The stalk this Pokémon carries in its wings serves as a sword to cut down opponents. In a dire situation, the stalk can also serve as food.

pokemon.name: doduo
pokemon.info: Its short wings make flying difficult. Instead, this Pokémon runs at high speed on developed legs.

pokemon.name: dodrio
pokemon.info: One of Doduo’s two heads splits to form a unique species. It runs close to 40 mph in prairies.

pokemon.name: seel
pokemon.info: Loves freezing-cold conditions. Relishes swimming in a frigid climate of around 14 degrees Fahrenheit.

pokemon.name: dewgong
pokemon.info: Its entire body is a snowy white. Unharmed by even intense cold, it swims powerfully in icy waters.

pokemon.name: grimer
pokemon.info: Made of congealed sludge. It smells too putrid to touch. Even weeds won’t grow in its path.

pokemon.name: muk
pokemon.info: Smells so awful, it can cause fainting. Through degeneration of its nose, it lost its sense of smell.

pokemon.name: shellder
pokemon.info: It swims facing backward by opening and closing its two-piece shell. It is surprisingly fast.

pokemon.name: cloyster
pokemon.info: Its shell is extremely hard. It cannot be shattered, even with a bomb. The shell opens only when it is attacking.

pokemon.name: gastly
pokemon.info: Born from gases, anyone would faint if engulfed by its gaseous body, which contains poison.

pokemon.name: haunter
pokemon.info: Its tongue is made of gas. If licked, its victim starts shaking constantly until death eventually comes.

pokemon.name: gengar
pokemon.info: On the night of a full moon, if shadows move on their own and laugh, it must be Gengar’s doing.

pokemon.name: onix
pokemon.info: As it digs through the ground, it absorbs many hard objects. This is what makes its body so solid.

pokemon.name: drowzee
pokemon.info: If you sleep by it all the time, it will sometimes show you dreams it had eaten in the past.

pokemon.name: hypno
pokemon.info: Avoid eye contact if you come across one. It will try to put you to sleep by using its pendulum.

pokemon.name: krabby
pokemon.info: It can be found near the sea. The large pincers grow back if they are torn out of their sockets.

pokemon.name: kingler
pokemon.info: Its large and hard pincer has 10,000-horsepower strength. However, being so big, it is unwieldy to move.

pokemon.name: voltorb
pokemon.info: It is said to camouflage itself as a Poké Ball. It will self-destruct with very little stimulus.

pokemon.name: electrode
pokemon.info: Stores electrical energy inside its body. Even the slightest shock could trigger a huge explosion.

pokemon.name: exeggcute
pokemon.info: Though it may look like it’s just a bunch of eggs, it’s a proper Pokémon. Exeggcute communicates with others of its kind via telepathy, apparently.

pokemon.name: exeggutor
pokemon.info: Each of Exeggutor’s three heads is thinking different thoughts. The three don’t seem to be very interested in one another.

pokemon.name: cubone
pokemon.info: When the memory of its departed mother brings it to tears, its cries echo mournfully within the skull it wears on its head.

pokemon.name: marowak
pokemon.info: This Pokémon overcame its sorrow to evolve a sturdy new body. Marowak faces its opponents bravely, using a bone as a weapon.

pokemon.name: hitmonlee
pokemon.info: This amazing Pokémon has an awesome sense of balance. It can kick in succession from any position.

pokemon.name: hitmonchan
pokemon.info: Its punches slice the air. They are launched at such high speed, even a slight graze could cause a burn.

pokemon.name: lickitung
pokemon.info: If this Pokémon’s sticky saliva gets on you and you don’t clean it off, an intense itch will set in. The itch won’t go away, either.

pokemon.name: koffing
pokemon.info: Its body is full of poisonous gas. It floats into garbage dumps, seeking out the fumes of raw, rotting trash.

pokemon.name: weezing
pokemon.info: It mixes gases between its two bodies. It’s said that these Pokémon were seen all over the Galar region back in the day.

pokemon.name: rhyhorn
pokemon.info: Strong, but not too bright, this Pokémon can shatter even a skyscraper with its charging tackles.

pokemon.name: rhydon
pokemon.info: It begins walking on its hind legs after evolution. It can punch holes through boulders with its horn.

pokemon.name: chansey
pokemon.info: The egg Chansey carries is not only delicious but also packed with nutrition. It’s used as a high-class cooking ingredient.

pokemon.name: tangela
pokemon.info: Hidden beneath a tangle of vines that grows nonstop even if the vines are torn off, this Pokémon’s true appearance remains a mystery.

pokemon.name: kangaskhan
pokemon.info: Although it’s carrying its baby in a pouch on its belly, Kangaskhan is swift on its feet. It intimidates its opponents with quick jabs.

pokemon.name: horsea
pokemon.info: Horsea makes its home in oceans with gentle currents. If this Pokémon is under attack, it spits out pitch-black ink and escapes.

pokemon.name: seadra
pokemon.info: It’s the males that raise the offspring. While Seadra are raising young, the spines on their backs secrete thicker and stronger poison.

pokemon.name: goldeen
pokemon.info: Its dorsal, pectoral, and tail fins wave elegantly in water. That is why it is known as the Water Dancer.

pokemon.name: seaking
pokemon.info: In autumn, its body becomes more fatty in preparing to propose to a mate. It takes on beautiful colors.

pokemon.name: staryu
pokemon.info: If you visit a beach at the end of summer, you’ll be able to see groups of Staryu lighting up in a steady rhythm.

pokemon.name: starmie
pokemon.info: This Pokémon has an organ known as its core. The organ glows in seven colors when Starmie is unleashing its potent psychic powers.

pokemon.name: mr-mime
pokemon.info: The broadness of its hands may be no coincidence—many scientists believe its palms became enlarged specifically for pantomiming.

pokemon.name: scyther
pokemon.info: As Scyther fights more and more battles, its scythes become sharper and sharper. With a single slice, Scyther can fell a massive tree.

pokemon.name: jynx
pokemon.info: Appears to move to a rhythm of its own, as if it were dancing. It wiggles its hips as it walks.

pokemon.name: electabuzz
pokemon.info: If a major power outage occurs, it is certain that this Pokémon has eaten electricity at a power plant.

pokemon.name: magmar
pokemon.info: Born in an active volcano. Its body is always cloaked in flames, so it looks like a big ball of fire.

pokemon.name: pinsir
pokemon.info: These Pokémon judge one another based on pincers. Thicker, more impressive pincers make for more popularity with the opposite gender.

pokemon.name: tauros
pokemon.info: When Tauros begins whipping itself with its tails, it’s a warning that the Pokémon is about to charge with astounding speed.

pokemon.name: magikarp
pokemon.info: It is virtually worthless in terms of both power and speed. It is the most weak and pathetic Pokémon in the world.

pokemon.name: gyarados
pokemon.info: It has an extremely aggressive nature. The Hyper Beam it shoots from its mouth totally incinerates all targets.

pokemon.name: lapras
pokemon.info: A smart and kindhearted Pokémon, it glides across the surface of the sea while its beautiful song echoes around it.

pokemon.name: ditto
pokemon.info: It can reconstitute its entire cellular structure to change into what it sees, but it returns to normal when it relaxes.

pokemon.name: eevee
pokemon.info: It has the ability to alter the composition of its body to suit its surrounding environment.

pokemon.name: vaporeon
pokemon.info: When Vaporeon’s fins begin to vibrate, it is a sign that rain will come within a few hours.

pokemon.name: jolteon
pokemon.info: If it is angered or startled, the fur all over its body bristles like sharp needles that pierce foes.

pokemon.name: flareon
pokemon.info: Once it has stored up enough heat, this Pokémon’s body temperature can reach up to 1,700 degrees Fahrenheit.

pokemon.name: porygon
pokemon.info: State-of-the-art technology was used to create Porygon. It was the first artificial Pokémon to be created via computer programming.

pokemon.name: omanyte
pokemon.info: An ancient Pokémon that was recovered from a fossil. It swam by cleverly twisting its 10 tentacles about.

pokemon.name: omastar
pokemon.info: Its sharp beak rings its mouth. Its shell was too big for it to move freely, so it became extinct.

pokemon.name: kabuto
pokemon.info: A Pokémon that was recovered from a fossil. It used the eyes on its back while hiding on the seafloor.

pokemon.name: kabutops
pokemon.info: A slim and fast swimmer. It sliced its prey with its sharp sickles and drank the body fluids.

pokemon.name: aerodactyl
pokemon.info: A savage Pokémon that died out in ancient times. It was resurrected using DNA taken from amber.

pokemon.name: snorlax
pokemon.info: It is not satisfied unless it eats over 880 pounds of food every day. When it is done eating, it goes promptly to sleep.

pokemon.name: articuno
pokemon.info: A legendary bird Pokémon. It freezes water that is contained in winter air and makes it snow.

pokemon.name: zapdos
pokemon.info: This legendary bird Pokémon is said to appear when the sky turns dark and lightning showers down.

pokemon.name: moltres
pokemon.info: A legendary bird Pokémon. As it flaps its flaming wings, even the night sky will turn red.

pokemon.name: dratini
pokemon.info: Long thought to be a myth, this Pokémon’s existence was only recently confirmed by a fisherman who caught one.

pokemon.name: dragonair
pokemon.info: According to a witness, its body was surrounded by a strange aura that gave it a mystical look.

pokemon.name: dragonite
pokemon.info: It is said that this Pokémon lives somewhere in the sea and that it flies. However, these are only rumors.

pokemon.name: mewtwo
pokemon.info: Its DNA is almost the same as Mew’s. However, its size and disposition are vastly different.

pokemon.name: mew
pokemon.info: When viewed through a microscope, this Pokémon’s short, fine, delicate hair can be seen.
